snippet: Americans who remain uninsured in 2016 despite having the option of buying health coverage through an Affordable Care Act marketplace will owe an average tax penalty of $969 per household.
abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation analysis finds Americans who stay uninsured in 2016 despite having choice of buying health coverage through Affordable Care Act marketplace will owe average tax penalty of $969 per household.
lead_paragraph: Americans who remain uninsured in 2016 despite having the option of buying health coverage through an Affordable Care Act marketplace will owe an average tax penalty of $969 per household.

headline.main: Americans Who Don’t Buy Health Coverage Face Heftier Fine in ’16, Analysis Finds
headline.print_headline: Americans Who Don’t Buy Health Coverage Face Heftier Fine in ’16, Analysis Finds

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
